Optional.description: #Elements in Destination List, if omitted the list will contain all the elements in the database

200-Response.description: List of Destination. Each element has the Place's Name, the Air Distance in meters (origin->destination), the Destination's Latitude and Longitude Coordinates and the Destination's Address

examples.title: FAIL TO LOCATE
Standard Error-Response:

Optional.description: The vehicle for which you want to calculate time and real distance. The possibile values are car, foot and bike; if absent it will be set to the default value car.
The city in which the search will be done. If the parameter is missing it will be set to the default city roma.

examples.title: Example:

200-Response.description: List of Destination. Each element has the Destination's Latitude and Longitude Coordinates, the distance origin->destination based on the vehicle taken in meters, the time in seconds needed to go from origin to destination, the Place's Name, and the Destination's Address [NOTE: the number of elements in the destinatin list is determined in the server config file at the moment is three]

Standard Error-Response:

Mandatory.description: the secret key needed to access the logs

Optional.description: the date in this form dd/mm/yyyy (if the date or month is single digit DO NOT write the zero). If absent will be set to today
allows to select a lower bound (included) for the time. Must be in the form hh:mm:ss. If absent will be set to 00:00:00
allows to select an upper bound (excluded) for the time. Must be in the form hh:mm:ss. If absent will be set to 23:59:59

200-Response.description: array of strings. Each element is a log
